text: Hey Andreas :wave: I don't think we have anything in boilerplate for it at the moment but I'll add an issue about adding something in as I think that makes perfect sense to include.

If you're looking for the same header/footer but with translated content we do have some documentation on it here (<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/how-to-manage-multi-language-content-with-HubSpots-cos#edit-global-content-in-a-multi-language-page>). Let me know if you don't happen to see that option when working on the global partial that you're using.
thanks, it is actually hubl from the posts itself like date and author and stuff that i would like to add
Just to clarify, this is for hardcoded pieces of a blog template like "*Date:* 1/2/2020", "*Author:* Test name", is that correct?

We don't have a built in way to translate those pieces like the partials at the moment but you could use conditionals based on the language set (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/variables#website-pages-variables>) e.g. `{% if content.language == 'en' %}do this{% endif %}`
